utterance.speaker: Sceme
utterance.content: Leonard and Penny’s bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard? Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You realize you and I could become brothers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not gonna be brothers. We’re not gonna be stepbrothers. Go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hope you’re right. ‘Cause a grown man living with his brother and his brother’s wife is weird.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Do you think your father’s doing unspeakable things to my mother?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you saying that because the things are unspeakable?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Your parents are old. Anything unspeakable was finished by 9:30. Go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry if this stuff is gonna make the ceremony awkward.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: God, I thought my brother fresh out of jail was gonna make everyone uncomfortable, but now this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, if you want me to sleep you’re gonna have to stop talking.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m gonna go pick up my family. Like an hour and half, two hours, depending on traffic.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, drive safe.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey, and do yourself a favour, all right? When Beverly gets here, do not bring up last night. All right? As far as you’re concerned, you don’t know anything, you didn’t see anything. I want you just to play dumb.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was nice of her to show us playing dumb with an example.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Oh. Hi. Okay, hey there, I got, I’m sorry, I got to go now.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Penny, wait.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: I wanted to thank you for going through all the trouble of planning a second wedding ceremony for me, but unfortunately I cannot attend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, why? What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Whuh, are we still doing the dumb thing? Okay, why, what’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: I just cannot stay here while your father goes out of his way to humiliate me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, golly, however did he humiliate you?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Stop it, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do I say stop what, or just throw in the towel?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: I don’t see why I should have to watch your father parade around with some bible-thumping bumpkin.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, excuse me, that is my mother you’re talking about, however accurately.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, Beverley, aren’t you overreacting a little? All we know is they shared a cab and had a nightcap.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And turned their phones off.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not helping, buddy. Mother, Penny and I really want you to be part of this. Please stay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, plus if you leave, Alfred will know he got under your skin.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Well, we can’t have that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, also, if they did have coitus, we’ll all be needing a skilled psychiatrist.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It is funny when you think about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe to you. You didn’t get a $500 traffic ticket.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because you were driving like a lunatic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, if thinking secret government agents are chasing you makes you a lunatic, then, yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj (doorbell rings)
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll get it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It didn’t help that you couldn’t walk a straight line when the cop pulled you over.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have performance anxiety. You of all people should know that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Air Force Officer
utterance.content: I’m looking for Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Air Force Officer
utterance.content: I have the right address, don’t I?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Address?

utterance.speaker: Air Force Officer
utterance.content: Is he here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Um, no.

utterance.speaker: Air Force Officer
utterance.content: Do you know where I can find him?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: May I ask what this is about?

utterance.speaker: Air Force Officer
utterance.content: No, you may not.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Very well.

utterance.speaker: Air Force Officer
utterance.content: Have him call me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard (off)
utterance.content: Raj, who’s at the door?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s not him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I can’t wait for you to meet everyone. I told them all about you.

utterance.speaker: Susan (Penny’s mother)
utterance.content: Like what? Do they know about your brother?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, not everything, just, like, the jail and drugs part.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: The world doesn’t need to know our problems.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, Mom, I’m sorry, but…

utterance.speaker: Wyatt (Penny’s father)
utterance.content: Hey, look, they got Walgreens here, too.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: You really think it’s helpful to change the subject, Wyatt?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Just trying to make this a happy trip, dear.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Well, quit it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, uh, Randall, can’t believe after all these years you finally get to visit me in California.

utterance.speaker: Randall (Penny’s brother)
utterance.content: Well, good thing I was a non-violent offender, otherwise I couldn’t have left the state.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: All right, that’s enough jail talk.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: Penny knows where I was, she sent me cigarettes.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: You sent your brother cigarettes?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: He was cooking and selling crystal meth, Susan, I think we can let the cigarettes slide.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Stop trying to be the cool dad, you have a shirt with our cat’s picture on it.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Anyway, we’re here, slugger.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s great, now they know where I live.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you talking about? They’ve always known where you live.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, if you want to go off the grid, you have to move out of your mother’s house.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can we take a moment to discuss that I just lied to the government for you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. I would not have done that for you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, please just call the man, see what he wants.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, all right.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, make sure you tell him that you weren’t home when he came by and that your Indian friend gave you the message the moment you stepped through the door.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, hello. Uh, this is Howard Wolowitz for Colonel Richard Williams.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I take it back, don’t mention me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi, Colonel Williams, how can I help you? What? Oh, uh, yes, he is from India. No, I don’t know his immigration status. Relax, I’m still on hold. Speaking. Okay, sure, I can meet with you on Thursday. Caltech is fine. Yeah, and may I ask what this is about? I may not?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s what he said to me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here you are, Mother.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m glad you decided to stay. It’s gonna be special for Penny and me to share this with you.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: I can’t wait for this day to be over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, special, like that. That’s them. Please don’t make things any more awkward than they already are.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, so less or equally awkward, got it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, guys, come on in.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: How is everyone today?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Good, and you?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Good, good.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I’m good, too.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, did you defile my mother or not?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Sheldon. You’re being rude.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: If I may, I can assure you, your mother and I did nothing more than share a cab and a conversation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did that conversation include the phrase your genitals are a joy to behold?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: That’s enough.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Look, I promise you, neither I, nor anyone, has ever said that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You don’t know his girlfriend very well.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or what a joy it is to behold my genitals.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, you guys, uh, get settled in, then we’ll go across the hall and say hi to everyone.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: You know, It’s hard to believe I’ve never met Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Well, he probably buys his illegal drugs from a local vendor.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Not funny, Wyatt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I thought it was really funny.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Well, fine, if everyone wants to make jokes about our problems, then I can, too. Knock, knock. Who’s there? Our family is an embarrassment.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: That’s not much of a joke.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Listen, Mom, I know you’re nervous, but I promise you, no one is gonna judge you or this family.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. It’s just we’re meeting Leonard’s parents for the first time, and, and they’re academics and, and intellectuals, and I don’t want them thinking we’re white trash.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: Well, what colour trash do you think they’ll believe?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: How could you think that I would spend the night with a man I just met?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A man named Jesus convinced you to build a church in Africa. You’re kind of a sucker.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, nothing happened, right? It’s over. Until we get married a third time, you guys will never have to see each other again.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Well, you know, actually that’s not the case. Mary may visit me in New York.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. And he’s never been to Texas.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Maybe we meet halfway.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? In the Chattahoochee National Forest in Georgia? I can’t be the only one that knows that’s halfway.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: You’re not seriously going to visit each other.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: And why wouldn’t we?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Oh please, you’re just saying this to antagonize me.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh, not at all. Mary happens to be a wonderful woman. And if it antagonizes you, that’s just a bonus.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mary, I’m sorry you’re in the middle of this.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: No, no, nothing to be sorry about. I genuinely like your father.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? But he’s a mediocre academic. And according to Beverley, his sexual prowess is sub-par. He’s basically Leonard with a bigger prostate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you saying that my dad’s not good enough for your mom?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, while also getting in a solid dig at you. Pretty efficient, huh?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. I’m going across the hall.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But why should you get to go and leave me here with your bickering parents?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, then you go.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Well, I don’t want to stay here with her. I’ll go.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: I’ll go with you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That still leaves me here with him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hang on, hang on. We’re smart, we can figure this out. Okay, so: Mary and Beverley can’t be together. Uh, Alfred and Beverley can’t be together. Leonard and I can’t be together. Now, I could be with Alfred but I don’t like his face. Oh, here. I’ve got it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who’s ready for a wedding?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great, now I have to start all over.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: So how’s the world of pharmaceuticals treating you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Pretty good. I actually just got assigned a much better territory.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: See what happens when you work hard?

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: Hey, she just sells drugs. I had to make ’em.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Okay, that’s enough. No more drug talk for the rest of this trip.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: I’ll drink to that.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Haven’t you had enough?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Penny drinks more than I do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I learned from the best.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Very nice, Wyatt. And you wonder why this one turned out the way he did.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: You see what I’ve gotta put up with.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What you’ve gotta put up with? Why did you have to go to jail?

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: It’s called getting caught, Mother.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Hey, there he is.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard. It’s so nice to see you again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, you, too. Hey, everyone, this is my mother, Beverley.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: We are not white trash.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you excited to see your son walk down the aisle?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Yes, I am. I’m just feeling a little guilty about all the trouble I’ve caused.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Oh, so am I.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You made God sad today, Mom.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, they haven’t done anything wrong. I think it’s nice they’re hitting it off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s still no reason to rush into anything. I mean, look at us. We took things remarkably slow. You and I, we didn’t even hold hands for two years.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It was a lot hotter than it sounds.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: You’re a patient young lady.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, hey. She’s mine, take a cold shower, grandpa.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t that colonel say what the meeting’s about? It has to be bad news.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Calm down, okay? Try not to think about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s really stupid advice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know that hurts my feelings.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Calm down, try not to think about it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why do I bother talking to you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, come on. What’s the worst that could come of this meeting?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. They take the invention away, and I get nothing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, that’s not so bad. You know what happened to the scientists that worked on the Manhattan Project? The government forced them to move to the desert. They had to live in secret, and when Oppenheimer objected to what they made him do, they destroyed his reputation.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s the point of that story?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I just read a book about Oppenheimer, seemed like a chance to show off. There he is, there’s my happy Hebraic homeboy. Yeah, that’s the smile I’m gonna remember when you’re living in the desert and I’m living with your wife.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: So, what do you do for a living?

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: Mommy, you want to take this one?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Um, Randall’s in between jobs.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: And court appearances.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: It’s nice to meet the woman who raised this fine young man. I’m looking forward to meeting his father.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Prepare to be disappointed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And he can’t wait to meet you, too. Can I get anyone a drink?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Well, I could use another beer.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: You’re done. He’s done.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. Is everyone getting to know each other?

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: Not at all.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Nice to see you again, Dr. Hofstadter. I’m, uh, Leonard’s friend, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Nice to see you, too.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh, I’m Alfred. Leonard’s father.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, hi. Uh, I’m sorry, did you two want to sit together?

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I was wondering why the front row was available.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, I think we’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why do people cry at weddings?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: They’re practicing for what’s coming later.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Thank you for cleaning yourself up for your sister’s wedding.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: Thank you for my new teeth.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Welcome to the family, Leonard. Don’t lend your new brother-in-law money.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We’re here today to celebrate love.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Urgh.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Sigh louder, no one heard you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Really, I can move.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not just Leonard and Penny’s love, but the love we have for them, as well as each other.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Speaking of love, STDs among the elderly are skyrocketing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Love is patient, but it’s not gonna put up with all the side chatter, so let’s knock it off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: At least she’s yelling at someone else for a change.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I understand everyone’s a little tense today, so I am just gonna get to the important stuff. Leonard, standing here with you in front of our family and friends is bringing up a lot of feelings. Like what a good idea it was to elope the first time. But also how incredibly happy you make me. Thank you for marrying me. Hopefully for the last time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, as a scientist, my job is to figure out why things happen. But I don’t think I’ll ever understand how someone like me could get to be with someone like you. You know, maybe I don’t

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Anybody have anything snarky to say about that? Didn’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: I’d like to say something. Beverly, I know that we don’t bring out the best in each other.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: I couldn’t agree more.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: That’s beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thank you. All right, let’s continue.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, excuse me, I need to say something to someone pretty special, and I just can’t wait any longer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s happening.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, you and I have our ups and downs. But I have always considered you my family. Even before the recent threat of our parents fornicating like wrinkly old rabbits. I don’t always show it, but you are of great importance to me. Both of you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay. I now pronounce you husband and wife. And weird other husband who came with the apartment.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Thank you for taking us to the airport.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I’m just thrilled we’re all getting along for a minute.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too. Beverly, I’m sorry if I upset you.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Water under the bridge, Alfred. Leonard, why don’t you get into the carpool lane?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Well, that’s a solid line. He can’t cross that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s okay. I can make it over.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: No, no, let’s plod along. It’ll make your father feel more comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: What makes me comfortable is knowing I don’t have to wake up tomorrow morning and see your sour face.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Do the world a favour, and don’t wake up tomorrow morning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was almost a minute.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: There’s a lot of traffic. Are we gonna be okay?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’ll be at the airport an hour before your flight.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Good. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Plenty of time for you to meet another geriatric boy toy.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Hey. I will not have you be disrespectful to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes ma’am.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, you’re mother’s an attractive woman. You need to get use to the fact that men are going to be interested in her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, and you need to drive the car and mind your business.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I will not have you be disrespectful to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, you’re not my mother.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Don’t you be disrespectful to her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes ma’am.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: You’ll get there. You’ve just gotta put some zing on it.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Penny, I don’t know what I was worried about. You’re friends are just lovely.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, Mom.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Although that Sheldon is a bit peculiar.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is he? I never noticed.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: He reminds me of that turkey we had who drowned looking up at the rain.

utterance.speaker: Randall
utterance.content: Cops, cops, be cool.
